     180             :  * A formatter can be used only once (its internal state is mutated)

     186             :  * This is used for example for WKT1_ESRI output to do name substitutions.

    1136       13367 :     if (i == wkt.size() || (wkt[i] != ']' && wkt[i] != ')')) {

    1172             : /** \brief Return a WKT representation of the tree structure.
    1173             :  */
    1174          25 : std::string WKTNode::toString() const {
    1175          25 :     std::string str(escapeIfQuotedString(d->value_));
    1176          25 :     if (!d->children_.empty()) {
    1177             :         str += "[";
    1178             :         bool first = true;
    1179          29 :         for (auto &child : d->children_) {
    1180          17 :             if (!first) {
    1181             :                 str += ',';
    1182             :             }
    1183             :             first = false;
    1184          34 :             str += child->toString();
    1185             :         }
    1186             :         str += "]";
    1187             :     }
    1188          25 :     return str;
    1189             : }

    2827         589 : UnitOfMeasure WKTParser::Private::guessUnitForParameter(

    2835         724 :                ci_find(paramName, "longitude") != std::string::npos ||
    2836         602 :                ci_find(paramName, "meridian") != std::string::npos ||

    2846             :     }

    3879             :     // following conventions from

    4317         575 : static bool isGeodeticCRS(const std::string &name) {
    4318        1055 :     return ci_equal(name, WKTConstants::GEODCRS) ||       // WKT2
    4319         956 :            ci_equal(name, WKTConstants::GEODETICCRS) ||   // WKT2
    4320         919 :            ci_equal(name, WKTConstants::GEOGCRS) ||       // WKT2 2019
    4321         883 :            ci_equal(name, WKTConstants::GEOGRAPHICCRS) || // WKT2 2019
    4322        1422 :            ci_equal(name, WKTConstants::GEOGCS) ||        // WKT1
    4323         982 :            ci_equal(name, WKTConstants::GEOCCS);          // WKT1
    4324             : }

    4328         575 : CRSPtr WKTParser::Private::buildCRS(const WKTNodeNNPtr &node) {
    4329             :     const auto *nodeP = node->GP();
    4330             :     const std::string &name(nodeP->value());
    4331             : 
    4332         575 :     if (isGeodeticCRS(name)) {
    4333         176 :         if (!isNull(nodeP->lookForChild(WKTConstants::BASEGEOGCRS,
    4334             :                                         WKTConstants::BASEGEODCRS))) {
    4335          17 :             return buildDerivedGeodeticCRS(node);
    4336             :         } else {

    4338             :         }
    4339             :     }
    4340             :

    4342         621 :         ci_equal(name, WKTConstants::PROJCRS) ||
    4343         222 :         ci_equal(name, WKTConstants::PROJECTEDCRS)) {
    4344         501 :         return util::nn_static_pointer_cast<CRS>(buildProjectedCRS(node));
    4345             :     }
    4346             :

    5960             : 
    5961             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    5962             : 
    5963             : /** \brief Instantiate a sub-class of BaseObject from a user specified text.
    5964             :  *
    5965             :  * The text can be a:
    5966             :  * <ul>
    5967             :  * <li>WKT string</li>
    5968             :  * <li>PROJ string</li>
    5969             :  * <li>database code, prefixed by its authoriy. e.g. "EPSG:4326"</li>
    5970             :  * <li>OGC URN. e.g. "urn:ogc:def:crs:EPSG::4326",
    5971             :  *     "urn:ogc:def:coordinateOperation:EPSG::1671",
    5972             :  *     "urn:ogc:def:ellipsoid:EPSG::7001"
    5973             :  *     or "urn:ogc:def:datum:EPSG::6326"</li>
    5974             :  * <li> OGC URN combining references for compound coordinate reference systems
    5975             :  *      e.g. "urn:ogc:def:crs,crs:EPSG::2393,crs:EPSG::5717"
    5976             :  *      We also accept a custom abbreviated syntax EPSG:2393+5717
    5977             :  * </li>
    5978             :  * <li> OGC URN combining references for references for projected or derived
    5979             :  * CRSs
    5980             :  *      e.g. for Projected 3D CRS "UTM zone 31N / WGS 84 (3D)"
    5981             :  *      "urn:ogc:def:crs,crs:EPSG::4979,cs:PROJ::ENh,coordinateOperation:EPSG::16031"
    5982             :  * </li>
    5983             :  * <li> OGC URN combining references for concatenated operations
    5984             :  *      e.g.
    5985             :  * "urn:ogc:def:coordinateOperation,coordinateOperation:EPSG::3895,coordinateOperation:EPSG::1618"</li>
    5986             :  * <li>an Object name. e.g "WGS 84", "WGS 84 / UTM zone 31N". In that case as
    5987             :  *     uniqueness is not guaranteed, the function may apply heuristics to
    5988             :  *     determine the appropriate best match.</li>
    5989             :  * <li>PROJJSON string</li>
    5990             :  * </ul>
    5991             :  *
    5992             :  * @param text One of the above mentioned text format
    5993             :  * @param dbContext Database context, or nullptr (in which case database
    5994             :  * lookups will not work)
    5995             :  * @param usePROJ4InitRules When set to true,
    5996             :  * init=epsg:XXXX syntax will be allowed and will be interpreted according to
    5997             :  * PROJ.4 and PROJ.5 rules, that is geodeticCRS will have longitude, latitude
    5998             :  * order and will expect/output coordinates in radians. ProjectedCRS will have
    5999             :  * easting, northing axis order (except the ones with Transverse Mercator South
    6000             :  * Orientated projection). In that mode, the epsg:XXXX syntax will be also
    6001             :  * interprated the same way.
    6002             :  * @throw ParsingException
    6003             :  */
    6004         171 : BaseObjectNNPtr createFromUserInput(const std::string &text,
    6005             :                                     const DatabaseContextPtr &dbContext,
    6006             :                                     bool usePROJ4InitRules) {
    6007         171 :     return createFromUserInput(text, dbContext, usePROJ4InitRules, nullptr);
    6008             : }
    6009             : 
    6010             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    6011             : 
    6012             : /** \brief Instantiate a sub-class of BaseObject from a user specified text.
    6013             :  *
    6014             :  * The text can be a:
    6015             :  * <ul>
    6016             :  * <li>WKT string</li>
    6017             :  * <li>PROJ string</li>
    6018             :  * <li>database code, prefixed by its authoriy. e.g. "EPSG:4326"</li>
    6019             :  * <li>OGC URN. e.g. "urn:ogc:def:crs:EPSG::4326",
    6020             :  *     "urn:ogc:def:coordinateOperation:EPSG::1671",
    6021             :  *     "urn:ogc:def:ellipsoid:EPSG::7001"
    6022             :  *     or "urn:ogc:def:datum:EPSG::6326"</li>
    6023             :  * <li> OGC URN combining references for compound coordinate reference systems
    6024             :  *      e.g. "urn:ogc:def:crs,crs:EPSG::2393,crs:EPSG::5717"
    6025             :  *      We also accept a custom abbreviated syntax EPSG:2393+5717
    6026             :  * </li>
    6027             :  * <li> OGC URN combining references for references for projected or derived
    6028             :  * CRSs
    6029             :  *      e.g. for Projected 3D CRS "UTM zone 31N / WGS 84 (3D)"
    6030             :  *      "urn:ogc:def:crs,crs:EPSG::4979,cs:PROJ::ENh,coordinateOperation:EPSG::16031"
    6031             :  * </li>
    6032             :  * <li> OGC URN combining references for concatenated operations
    6033             :  *      e.g.
    6034             :  * "urn:ogc:def:coordinateOperation,coordinateOperation:EPSG::3895,coordinateOperation:EPSG::1618"</li>
    6035             :  * <li>an Object name. e.g "WGS 84", "WGS 84 / UTM zone 31N". In that case as
    6036             :  *     uniqueness is not guaranteed, the function may apply heuristics to
    6037             :  *     determine the appropriate best match.</li>
    6038             :  * <li>PROJJSON string</li>
    6039             :  * </ul>
    6040             :  *
    6041             :  * @param text One of the above mentioned text format
    6042             :  * @param ctx PROJ context
    6043             :  * @throw ParsingException
    6044             :  */
    6045        1063 : BaseObjectNNPtr createFromUserInput(const std::string &text, PJ_CONTEXT *ctx) {

    6047             :     try {
    6048        1063 :         if (ctx != nullptr && ctx->cpp_context) {

    6050             :         }
    6051           2 :     } catch (const std::exception &) {
    6052             :     }
    6053        1993 :     return createFromUserInput(text, dbContext, false, ctx);
    6054             : }
    6055             : 
    6056             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    6057             : 
    6058             : /** \brief Instantiate a sub-class of BaseObject from a WKT string.
    6059             :  *
    6060             :  * By default, validation is strict (to the extent of the checks that are
    6061             :  * actually implemented. Currently only WKT1 strict grammar is checked), and
    6062             :  * any issue detected will cause an exception to be thrown, unless
    6063             :  * setStrict(false) is called priorly.
    6064             :  *
    6065             :  * In non-strict mode, non-fatal issues will be recovered and simply listed
    6066             :  * in warningList(). This does not prevent more severe errors to cause an
    6067             :  * exception to be thrown.
    6068             :  *
    6069             :  * @throw ParsingException
    6070             :  */
    6071         450 : BaseObjectNNPtr WKTParser::createFromWKT(const std::string &wkt) {

    6339             : /** \brief Constructs a new formatter.
    6340             :  *
    6341             :  * A formatter can be used only once (its internal state is mutated)
    6342             :  *
    6343             :  * Its default behaviour can be adjusted with the different setters.
    6344             :  *

    6666      280954 :                     nextStep.paramValues.size() == 1 &&
    6667         628 :                     nextStep.paramValues[0].equals("order", "2,1")) {
    6668         550 :                     d->steps_.erase(iterPrev);
    6669         550 :                     d->steps_.erase(iterNext);
    6670             :                     changeDone = true;
    6671             :                     break;
    6672             :                 }
    6673             :             }
    6674             : 
    6675             :             // for practical purposes WGS84 and GRS80 ellipsoids are
    6676             :             // equivalents (cartesian transform between both lead to differences
    6677             :             // of the order of 1e-14 deg..).
    6678             :             // No need to do a cart roundtrip for that...
    6679             :             // and actually IGNF uses the GRS80 definition for the WGS84 datum
    6680      189223 :             if (curStep.name == "cart" && prevStep.name == "cart" &&
    6681       31815 :                 curStep.inverted == !prevStep.inverted &&
    6682     1192875 :                 curStepParamCount == 1 && prevStepParamCount == 1 &&

    6684       32624 :                   prevStep.paramValues[0].equals("ellps", "GRS80")) ||

    6686       22481 :                   prevStep.paramValues[0].equals("ellps", "WGS84")))) {
    6687             :                 ++iterCur;
    6688       16508 :                 d->steps_.erase(iterPrev, iterCur);
    6689             :                 changeDone = true;
    6690             :                 break;
    6691             :             }
    6692             : 
    6693       14593 :             if (curStep.name == "helmert" && prevStep.name == "helmert" &&
    6694         104 :                 !curStep.inverted && !prevStep.inverted &&
    6695     1112823 :                 curStepParamCount == 3 &&
    6696          43 :                 curStepParamCount == prevStepParamCount) {
    6697             :                 std::map<std::string, double> leftParamsMap;
    6698             :                 std::map<std::string, double> rightParamsMap;

    6700          72 :                     for (const auto &kv : prevStep.paramValues) {
    6701          54 :                         leftParamsMap[kv.key] = c_locale_stod(kv.value);
    6702             :                     }
    6703          72 :                     for (const auto &kv : curStep.paramValues) {
    6704          54 :                         rightParamsMap[kv.key] = c_locale_stod(kv.value);
    6705             :                     }
    6706           0 :                 } catch (const std::invalid_argument &) {
    6707             :                     break;
    6708             :                 }

    6712          18 :                 if (leftParamsMap.find(x) != leftParamsMap.end() &&
    6713          18 :                     leftParamsMap.find(y) != leftParamsMap.end() &&

    6739             : 
    6740             :             // hermert followed by its inverse is a no-op
    6741       14539 :             if (curStep.name == "helmert" && prevStep.name == "helmert" &&
    6742     1112787 :                 !curStep.inverted && !prevStep.inverted &&
    6743             :                 curStepParamCount == prevStepParamCount) {

    7177      285352 :     if (std::abs(val * 10 - std::round(val * 10)) < 1e-8) {
    7178             :         // For the purpose of
    7179             :         // https://www.epsg-registry.org/export.htm?wkt=urn:ogc:def:crs:EPSG::27561

    7181             :         // to
    7182             :         // 49.5 deg
    7183      126576 :         val = std::round(val * 10) / 10;
    7184             :     }

    7487             : /** \brief Set how init=epsg:XXXX syntax should be interpreted.

    7489             :  * @param enable When set to true,
    7490             :  * init=epsg:XXXX syntax will be allowed and will be interpreted according to
    7491             :  * PROJ.4 and PROJ.5 rules, that is geodeticCRS will have longitude, latitude
    7492             :  * order and will expect/output coordinates in radians. ProjectedCRS will have
    7493             :  * easting, northing axis order (except the ones with Transverse Mercator South

    7554          33 : static const LinearUnitDesc *getLinearUnits(double toMeter) {
    7555         907 :     for (const auto &desc : linearUnitDescs) {
    7556         926 :         if (std::fabs(c_locale_stod(desc.convToMeter) - toMeter) <
    7557         463 :             1e-10 * toMeter) {
    7558             :             return &desc;
    7559             :         }
    7560             :     }
    7561             :     return nullptr;
    7562             : }

    7673         786 : static bool isProjectedStep(const std::string &name) {
    7674        3057 :     if (name == "etmerc" || name == "utm" ||
    7675        1903 :         !getMappingsFromPROJName(name).empty()) {
    7676             :         return true;
    7677             :     }
    7678             :     // IMPROVE ME: have a better way of distinguishing projections from
    7679             :     // other

    8400        1264 : static bool is_in_stringlist(const std::string &str, const char *stringlist) {
    8401        1264 :     if (str.empty())
    8402             :         return false;
    8403             :     const char *haystack = stringlist;
    8404             :     while (true) {
    8405             :         const char *res = strstr(haystack, str.c_str());
    8406        6386 :         if (res == nullptr)
    8407             :             return false;
    8408        6028 :         if ((res == stringlist || res[-1] == ',') &&
    8409         816 :             (res[str.size()] == ',' || res[str.size()] == '\0'))
    8410             :             return true;
    8411        5124 :         haystack += str.size();
    8412        5124 :     }
    8413             : }
